website_summaries.verdict: Just add a vegetarian protein of your choice (such as beans, peas, or tofu) to this nut and vegetable base mix.
pros: With its variety of wholesome plant-based ingredients, such as sweet potato and cabbage, there's no denying this is a healthy food for your canine companions
Small packs go a long way once rehydrated
Excellent for dogs with allergies or anyone who prefers to feed their dog a grain-free diet
cons: Some buyers lament that it's not completely vegan due to the addition of honey and vitamin D3

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I feed raw and have been for 15 yrs. Some say dogs don't need veggies and some say they do. One of my 3 labs , my 10-yr old, has osteosarcoma and I started giving him this product a few days a week after the diagnosis. Is it helping? He is still alive and in remission almost 1 yr since diagnosis; no amputation-radiation and chemotherapy. Is it because of this product? Maybe not entirely but who knows for sure? He will keep getting it a few days a week for as long as he is with me.
customer_reviews.author: AA in CO

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Dogs drink 50% less water than when they were on Taste of the Wild dry dog food. Poop stinks 50% less than the horse sh*t smell that used to come out of their a**es. Regular pooping schedule now. I add hot water, let it cool and thicken, 1/2c ground turkey, 1 pump salmon oil, and 1 whole boiled egg. BAM, dinner served, dogs are happy, and I'm happy because I feel like I just made them Thanksgiving dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Tony V

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, whole ingredients - just what they deserve!
customer_reviews.text: I'm always searching for the very best way to feed my dogs. In my opinion, the best thing for them is whole ingredients. Like what us humans eat! And while I have some time to cook up meals for them, I don't have THAT much time. This base mix is awesome. It has so many awesome, whole ingredients including things I can't always obtain to put in the food I make for my dogs myself. This makes me happy and more relaxed that I'm doing whats best for them. I just add their favorite meat, chicken, and water - voila! This was the first box I've used and I will absolutely be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyMortimerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this! He gets so excited for dinnertime. I was cautious when purchasing the first time because I thought it would make feeding the pup take much longer, but it really doesn't. I cook up protein in large batches on the weekend to make it manageable during the week. Put half in the fridge, half in the freezer. When I only have one days protein left, I move the freezer protein to the fridge. Works like a charm and doesn't take much longer than scooping kibble.
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: Allergies are GONE
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm a little shook from the results. So my dog was on apoquel for 10 months, her hives were outrageous, itchy, bursting, painful. It was on and off, one month good and the other horrible, I tried eliminate proteins but it wasn't giving any clear answers. Then I found honest kitchen and other omega 3 supplement, and oh boy it did changed my dog's life. She's been off of apoquel for 2 months, no hives, itching or any other allergy symptoms! The only thing is that she will eat it only when I form those little meatballs which I don't mind doing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Carrot
customer_reviews.text: It's human grade, nothing from China and BALANCED. Very good so far. But I still have problem with carrots in it. My dog cannot digest it if I do not blend it using a blender. In general, dogs cannot digest carrots well, and I am not sure why honest kitchen included it the first place, and also why they do not modify the receipe considering all the complaints/feedback they get from customer. I would love to hear from them. The price is high too, but that's the price we have to pay for a relatively decent food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charging More for Less!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in Honest Kitchen. I used to be an avid customer and loved their product, but they have cut all their ingredients in the mix! I have to feed 3 cups rather than the 1 cup I originally fed. With 3 large dogs, that goes way too fast. Compare your old boxes to the new one. You'll see what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch pricing
customer_reviews.text: I like this product very much. I have an older pup who has a sensitive stomach and this base mix was a welcome addition to his diet. But I was appalled when I reordered another box and discovered the price had gone up more than 50%. At the previous price of $36.43 it was expensive but worth the cost for the benefit my pup had from the product. The current price of $56.79 seems like a cruel joke, I just hit the reorder button and didn't look at the price. Need less to say I will be looking into other companies alternatives and never doing business with Dishonest Kitchen again..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Now mixes better
customer_reviews.text: Something The Honest Kitchen did to the formula recently has improved it ten-fold. It mixes with water more smoothly and rehydrates more quickly. And with no other food changes, our underweight Boston with gut issues is now making solid stool (awww, cute, I know) and has put on much-needed weight. He's been on this base with added fish protein for 3-4 years now, so this is a noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soft food for pets stricken with cancer
customer_reviews.text: My dog's holistic vet recommended Honest Kitchen for him, he had been diagnosed with tonsil cancer. Charlie loves the food, it's easy for him to eat plus I know he's getting the nutrients he needs. I will be starting my other dog on Honest Kitchen once she has finished her present bag of kibble. Love that it is all natural.
customer_reviews.author: S. Batterman

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak for the flavor, because I didn’t eat it, my dog did. She can take it or leave it, but I didn’t really buy it for the flavor. She has so many allergy issues to grains and so I bought this mainly for the vitamin and mineral content as a supplement when adding to her canned meat she gets every day. It does meet her needs for vitamin and mineral requirements, but it is pretty much just a bunch of dehydrated herbs and vegetables, so to me, it’s quite pricey for what it is. As a vitamin Supplement, I would say it’s great. As an actual form of sustenance for a meal, probably not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Devours Her Food Now!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality base to which you add your own raw or cooked meat. We choose to feed our dog raw. We much prefer this brand to others we've tried, as the veggie bits are very fine. Our dog is a picky eater and would literally spit out little pieces of carrot when she found them in the other brand. This brand, she will wolf down the whole bowl in minutes, and then stares at us hoping for more!
customer_reviews.author: Susanna_Parkton

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea+++
customer_reviews.text: Gave my American Bulldog horrible diarrhea even with a very slow introduction. I’ve read on other raw food sites that others have had the same problem. No refund by the company, which is unusual for a high-end supposedly high-quality dog food so owner beware.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Remember To Wipe Your Dogs Mouth After!
customer_reviews.text: My 6yo lab really loves this food, however he's a typical lab who will eat anything you put in his bowl! I love that this food can be bought in stores locally, so sometimes when we are in a pinch we can quickly grab a new box. However, my biggest complaint with the Honest Kitchen food in general is that no matter what consistency you make it, it always sticks to my dog's gums/mouth. Have tried other base mixes by other companies and they do not do that. Especially considering this line is GREEN, it makes for quite a mess if you don't remember to clean their mouth after.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Not good for my guy
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would solve my dogs allergy problem, but no. He had a bad reaction to this, even without the potato and fruit. His ears flamed up and he was miserable. I even tried it without the meat, just to be sure. Not sure what in this product would cause this, but it was a waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I really don't know what it tastes like but my dogs love it. It is green when mixed up. Not very appetizing to me but I'm not eating eat. I would brown ground turkey to go in it for the protein. I had a dog with high liver enzymes which can be because they are on too much protein. This allowed me to control how much and what kind of protein I used. She was fine at the next vet check. I alternated a box of this with regular kibble. Do let it sit a bit longer than it says on the box to rehydrate.
customer_reviews.author: D. Slater

customer_reviews.title: A fabulous low fat, grain free food
customer_reviews.text: We have a mini schnauzer that suffers from pancreatitis as well as some food allergies and we had a difficult time finding a top quality food for him that met the low fat/grain free requirements. We had been using Royal Canine Gastro Low Fat food for years but Max suddenly acquired a horrible allergy to it...itchy skin, hives and persistent infections from scratching. Honest Kitchen has certainly solved the problem. We simply add poached skinless, boneless chicken to the hydrated base mix, throw in a couple of salt free canned beans for an extra treat and he's a very, very happy and healthy boy. I can't recommend this product enough.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great for Frenchies and dogs with sensitive stomachs/allergies
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this food!!!! My frenchie has a very sensitive stomach (like most) and was extremely gassy. She had very loose stools, and was starting to smell metallic-ish due to anal glands not expelling. I looked online about this, and nothing I read suggested it could be the food they’re eating...interested. A couple days after switching to this dehydrated food blend (I also mix with Tucker’s raw meat) her stools are firm and she has NO metallic smell anymore. She also has literally no gas whatsoever, which frenchies are known for. I highly, highly recommend this dog food! I will never feed her anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: My dog eats a very healthy whole foods diet with absolutly no junk foods or fillers. This product made my dog have severe itching all over her body. I actually called amazon service and informed them of my concern for the reaction that occured. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sophina W.

customer_reviews.title: No more skin and digestive problems
customer_reviews.text: Our Welsh Terrier had developed first yeast (itching) and then digestive problems. We were very concerned that she was becoming very ill. After lots of trips to the vet, with only temporary relief, we discovered that she had food sensitivities and could not tolerate grains, starches and potatoes (both white and sweet). After much searching, the Honest Kitchen's Kindly Base Mix meet our needs - no grains and no potatoes. She loves it, and more importantly, it loves her! Simply add the protein of choice (we use poached chicken thighs) in the amounts recommended. Her coat is glorious and her digestive processes work like clockwork.
customer_reviews.author: JayBee

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! CONTAINS GARLIC
customer_reviews.text: Although I love the entire concept of this and made homemade food for my senior dog for a while, I can no longer recommend this particular Honest Kitchen formula. It contains garlic. Most veterinarians do not recommend garlic for dogs. In our case, it caused our sheltie (collie) to have anemia that caused complications during her surgery. I can't recommend any dog product with garlic. I may try their other formula without garlic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easily digestible food for senior dog
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely, hands down the best food I could’ve found for my 14 year old dog with reflux issues. He has much fewer issues with reflux, stomach upset, vomiting, etc. His poop is pristine. Always well-formed, easy to pick up and not nearly as smelly as typical dog poop. Since he sometimes has trouble getting up and doesn’t always make it out of the house in time to go, this food has seriously improved everyone’s quality of life. It is expensive and you have to also pay for a protein source, but to me, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Xolo_Mom

customer_reviews.title: A must addition to a raw food diet!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is just wonderful. We have Rhodesian Ridgebacks, who are a personality, to say the least. We feed a raw chicken, pork fat, river fish all bone-in, diet. He eats the meat first for whatever reason but then attempts to lick the stainless steel off the stainless steel dishes. He absolutely loves this flavor!! It makes it so easy to meal prep for him, add the powder, meat into a ziplock and when ready to feed put it in the dish and add warm water, done. Let it sit (great obedience training time, really gets their mind going) and you have one happy puppy!
customer_reviews.author: Bryguy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs like it just mixed w a little warm water
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Honest Kitchen for about 6 months for my 4 dogs' dinner. I follow instructions on the back of the box. My dogs like it just mixed w a little warm water. I put the measured portion on their plate next to the meat. All except for the Toy Poodle. For him, I mix it with the protein. My dogs are all healthy; in "good condition" my vet says. My groomer says their coats are in good condition. Honest Kitchen simplified my dog feeding regimen. So, it's a Win-Win all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes my raw fed life easier
customer_reviews.text: I can only say it’s Obvious my dog likes that flavor. He hasn’t had any negative reactions and if all claims on package are true, I’m glad he is getting the vitamins and minerals without guess work. I feed a raw diet so using this along with meat makes my dog have more frequent bowel movements from all the fiber in vegetables but it’s not a huge difference and it’s easy to use. Less mess than trying to get a vitamins and minerals incorporated yourself through diet. I just wonder about calcium. I may add some additional in food form
customer_reviews.author: Maria Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 very big dogs. When I was feeding raw with fresh fruits and vegetables, I found it to be difficult to find any poops in the yard. I was excited to try this stuff because keeping veggies fresh is a real pain. But, I found that the poops on this stuff were as big as when I was feeding kibble. Which tells me that there are lots of indigestible fillers in this product. Which is super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Martin

customer_reviews.title: My beagle loves it!
customer_reviews.text: After months of research and feeding different food, I finally decided to feed my 9 year old beagle the 6 fish Orijen kibble and this particular base mix. He absolutely loved it! I like the ingrediends of this mix and the convenience in preparing it. Highly recommend.🐕👍
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great food additive to raw food diet.
customer_reviews.text: We prepare raw meat for our dogs. 70 meals at a time to freeze ahead. We use this for the “everything else but meat & oil component” By adding a variety of oils, some cooked eggs we believe we are providing the highest quality possible raw food diet without spending a lot of time shopping for organic non-meat products & preparing them as well. Our butcher grinds all of our meat & fish together, do we simply add the rest at home.
customer_reviews.author: RosaLee

customer_reviews.title: Best of both words for raw with guaranteed nutrition!
customer_reviews.text: I love the honest kitchen company. They have great ethics and produce some high quality products that I trust and my dog adores. I feed this formula as part of my rotational diet and I love the variety that this food allows me to introduce. Most days, I mix this with 1 can of sardines (canned in water, no salt added) for the benefit of fish but I also will add in raw venison, chicken, or ground beef or whatever other meat we may have around the house. I love that this gives me the peace of mind by balancing/providing the vitamins and minerals while giving my dog the nutrition she needs!
customer_reviews.author: equestriennesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good but too much starch and pricey for the amount you get
customer_reviews.text: My 2 dogs, English mastiff and a Dogo, are both on raw. This base mix made serving raw extremely easy. Sometimes I even use beef broth or chicken broth instead of regular warm water. I would give this product 5 stars but my English start having yeast in his ears ever since we started this base mix. And the price can be a little less too since I use 3 boxes per month.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good—but might be a bit coarse for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My Italian Greyhound tolerates this when mixed with some boiled chicken or some salmon / steak. He'll eat it if he has to, but have noticed that in the last year or so the cut has become larger and more coarse, he often is coughing up pieces up while eating (a friend who has his sister complains of the same thing). Would love it if they could produce a finer ground mix. This happens regardless of how well soaked and moist the mix is—I also think it could be from the coconut skins (think of popcorn kernels stuck in the back of your throat).
customer_reviews.author: Roocious Maximums

customer_reviews.title: Easy with organic veggies
customer_reviews.text: We use the Grain free hydrated veggie mix and I add the chicken or turkey plus organ meat etc. as recommended in Dr. Karen Becker's cookbook for pets (I bought mine on Amazon). This is so easy to use and has all the veggies my dogs need. I mix 1 cup dry with 1 1/2 cups warm water, wait 3 minutes and it's ready. Couldn't be easier or healthier--organic. Tastes good, too. You can save money with the monthly subscription plan.
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't dissolve like the chicken and turkey varieties
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my dogs The Honest Kitchen in different varieties for a while now. I decided to try this out and add raw meat to it and the consistency is very off. It doesn't dissolve like the chicken and turkey varieties. You absolutely have to put this through a blender of some sort to get it to mix. Very disappointed in that
customer_reviews.author: vizualeyesit

customer_reviews.title: Can give your dog diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I tried Kindly. I always purchased Keen in the past and it was fine. I thought I'd try something new, but it gave my dog diarrhea. It is so expensive and now I'm stuck with it. Maybe not a good idea to purchase through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: J. LaBeau

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My dog has protein allergies to fowl and beef. I use this with Canine Caviar meat products (in cans) like Venison (smells bad, but he loves it) and Salman or with home cooked meats like Salmon and pork. Manufacturers are now starting to sell kangaroo meat and wild animal meat like boar. Those work for my dog and his allergies.
customer_reviews.author: L. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food ever.
customer_reviews.text: Best dog food ever. My 6.5 lb Dixie has a very sensitive stomach and everything I fed her made her sick. I bought this and have had no problems at all! I add hot water 2Tablespoons of dry mix let it sit for 3 mins stir add protein (a little very little butternut squash or sweet potato stir and feed. She loves it. Her weight is stable and she's a happy little camper. I highly reckoned this food.
customer_reviews.author: NANA R

customer_reviews.title: She's waiting for me to put the bowl down.
customer_reviews.text: My little girl was so picky before with her food. She'd go for days without eating. She'd walk over to the bowl take a whiff and turn right back around. With this food, she's sitting there waiting for me to put it down. She hasn't missed a meal in the six months I've been using it. And it works out to be a little cheaper than the premium food I was buying before. And another thing, my vet told me that he was getting a lot of dogs with pancreatitis and kidney disease that were on that same premium food.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Best pet food base mix on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love this product and so do I!! We have one dog with really bad food allergies from any kind of kibble. We’ve tried everyone we could find that was supposed to fit his diet. Every time it ended with horrible results, mostly itching himself raw or chewing his fur off to the skin. We now do this mix with a protein (we switch it up from chicken, beef, pork, and venison) and have not had issues at all. Including when we change the protein. Can’t recommend this product enough!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wondering if it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: So far my babies love it. But I've noticed that they poop and pee a lot more after beginning this food.This food is also very messy. I have three miniature schnauzers with medium to long beards and they get food all over them. I have to clip back their beards, then wipe their faces after every meal. It's kind of a pain. I'm going to see how the next couple weeks go to see if I want to continue with this food.
customer_reviews.author: Grill

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Healthy, Great For Our Dogs Mental and Physical Health
customer_reviews.text: This dehydrated Preference Base product has been great for our dog. We feel much better about feeding him real food. His behavior improved and his coat is so much healthier. After switching to grain free whole foods, he lost that edgy energy that many assume is synonymous with Jack Russell type dogs. The mix travels well and only takes a couple of minutes to hydrate. We add real sliced or ground meet to this for a complete meal. He seems to enjoy the taste and is thriving physically and mentally on the diet.
customer_reviews.author: LoveaGoodBook

customer_reviews.title: Great food, convenient too
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food and doesn't spend 10 minutes scratching his snout after eating like he did with all the kibbles we have tried. He is a very energetic dog, hiking several miles with us daily, and he has more energy now than ever. He no longer eats grass, so this is the right food for him.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: She loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Gracie has a history of pancreatitis and needs a low fat diet. By itself, this product might be a bit high in fat; but I use this product as a base and then add ground chicken or turkey breast--sometimes 4% beef. She LOVES it. No more pancreatitis attacks since she's been on it. Delivery is always prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Walker

customer_reviews.title: Feed 20 percent or less if diet.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for convenience and to get some trace vitamins in my dogs diet. They get 10 to 15 percent base mix, 10 percent organ meet and the rest raw meat and raw meaty bones. I think feeding more than 20 percent veg. Would be excessive except in special circumstances like allergies. So i think this is a great convenient product when used sparingly as part of a raw food diet. Sometimes i mix the hydrated meal with pureed liver to improve paletabilty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only food my dog can tolerate.
customer_reviews.text: My Westie dog went through his first 1 1/2 years with diharrea and pain. Finally someone recommended this food. It is dehydrated fruits and veggies. You cook the meat and add 50%-50%. He has never had diharrea since. The vet said he is the most beautiful and healthy Westie he has ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Makes Raw Easy
customer_reviews.text: I use unsalted broth instead of water and my picky Weiner dog LOVES it. I can finally get him to completely eat everything after he picks out the meat. Since he's on a raw diet, any vegetables or fruits we add get completely ignored in favor of the meat, but not anymore. Devours the whole plate. I use the proportions the box recommends, varying it based on his activity and it's perfect. He licks the empty plate hoping for more.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Soca

customer_reviews.title: Only downside is price, but the dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this product as it is a balanced premix and I just have to add protein. I’ve been a big fan of THK for a while now. However I feed 2 40lbs and 1 10lbs so it’s not the best bang for your buck. I have to get more food every 2-2 1/2 weeks. It adds up but they love it so what are you going to do. Unfortunately lots of grain free is more expensive. This is a great product though and I highly recommend it. Only downside is price due to feeding 3 dogs for me.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product heading
customer_reviews.text: This product heading is misleading (Honest Kitchen Grain Free Veggie, Nut & Seed Base Mix Recipe). I thought I was purchasing Kindly but what I received is Preference. On The Honest Kitchen website, the Kindly is advertised as "Grain Free Veggie, Nut & Seed Base Mix (Kindly)". Preference, which is what I received is advertised on THK website as "Dehydrated Grain Free Fruit & Veggie Base Mix (Preference)". You people need to clear this up.
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: My dogs sing it’s praises as soon as they hear me open the jar.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this product. They love anything from Honest Kitchen honestly (pun intended). This particular product you add your own protein source which I like. We go to our local dairy once a week and purchase pasture raised beef, chicken and pork so I know they are receiving the best I can provide. Will continue to purchase this product. Thank you Amazon for carrying this item. I reconstitute with filtered well water and it comes out perfect every time. I allow it to sit five minutes then add my protein either raw or cooked. Add more water if necessary. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Good for your dog, save on vet bills!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a mix of cooked ground turkey and my dog loves it. It gives me piece of mind to know my dog is eating human grade food. He was a bit overweight before we started him in this grain free honest kitchen/ground turkey meal and he’s almost down to his ideal weight after 4 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been making food for my dog for more than a year. We now have a new puppy so I was looking for a way to give them the right nutrients without having to get my nutrition degree and a complete science lab in my kitchen. My dogs love this stuff and all I need is measuring cups, water and some cooked meat (beef, chicken, turkey, whatever).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems healthy - wish it were organic.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs like this and it's easy for me to use. I was making my own veggie sauce for my pups, but activities like camping made me look for a dehydrated product like this. I'm happy with Honest Kitchen's grain free base mix. I do supplement with organic and fermented vitamins, minerals, and probiotics from Dr. Peter Dobias' website. This product helps me feed my dogs an almost meat free diet. Thank you honest kitchen for making this.
customer_reviews.author: anacapa

customer_reviews.title: A godsend to our beloved pet
customer_reviews.text: Saved my dog from pancreatitis! High quality and human grade. Kibble will kill your dog! My girl gets up every morning now full of life and begging for her food. She has lost 5lbs which she needed, no more bloat or struvite stones. So regret all the time she was ill when I did not know a healthier option. All I can hope we added years to her life at 12 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: They continue to love it, and after three weeks
customer_reviews.text: I started adding 1/4 cup to both of my dogs' dry kibble for added nutrition. I was expecting (based on the vibrant greens and texture) they would take a few days to adapt, maybe dealing with some loose stool. Much to my surprise, not even a little! They gobbled it up, and I never had to handle any GI or intestinal revolt. They continue to love it, and after three weeks, they seem to be less itchy than normal, and trimming up around the mid-section!
customer_reviews.author: Hollywoof to the Rescue

customer_reviews.title: Doodle says YUMM
customer_reviews.text: My doodle loves this stuff! I usually mix it with raw chicken or ground turkey but sometimes I will mix it up with other kinds of meat. With the recommended amount of water it tends to be on the soupy side. I've noticed my doodle doesn't like that so I add a little less water. My doodle recommends this product!
customer_reviews.author: Kasie

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn’t eat this food
customer_reviews.text: Liked the concept of this food since I’ve had my dog on a homemade diet for a couple of years and thought this would save me some time on washing, peeling, chopping, and cooking veggies, but unfortunately my mini schnauzer wouldn’t eat it. It’s very green and smells like spinach more than anything else. Maybe too many greens for my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Just don't use too much, I add water to it then add it to raw meat for my dogs. It makes me feel good that they are getting a bit of veggies with their meat. I also juice carrots and add the pulp to their meat.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: ... to get the right consistency that your dog will love mine prefers a more soupy instead of of the ...
customer_reviews.text: the ratio chart is just a base to start with take your time tweaking the mix/water/meat ratios to get the right consistency that your dog will love mine prefers a more soupy instead of of the oatmeal or cream of wheat texture. we also left the feeder with her dry kibble full on the floor because it didn't seem like she would get enough to eat and after 3 weeks the dry dog food has been virtually untouched
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM D.

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Our Raiden was very picky with what foods he would eat. We finally settled on trying this type of food and he loved it! His coat is beautiful and has not had any issues with allergies or his skin. It's a little more work than your average dog food, but so worth it to have a healthy dog. I recommend this food to anyone who asks what we feed him.
customer_reviews.author: Raiden's Mom

customer_reviews.title: It's a good idea, but my dog didn't think so.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea, but my dog didn't think so. I was looking for something to balance my dogs strict diet of chicken and rice (he has chronic pancreatitis). He would not eat this, even on a good day. That said it is usually a bit of a picky eater. I tried several ways of preparing this with his meals (different ratios and textures, etc.). It has a strong kale smell. It's expensive, so if you think your dog wont eat it but you want to try it go for the littlest box you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Katie G

customer_reviews.title: When the dog says no to a new food. Honest Kitchen Grain free Base Mix.
customer_reviews.text: At first my dog really seemed to like it and I liked the convenience of giving her good wholesome, real food, however, about half way through the box, she started eating around it, picking out the meat chunks and leaving the base mix. I have stopped it for a while and tried to reintroduce it and she is refusing to eat it. Sorry, I was really hoping for a positive outcome.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Jordan

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it with her raw meat.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this along with raw for my pittie for about 3-4 years now and she ALWAYS eats her food and goes back later and licks the greens from the bowl. I use 1cuo a day in two meals and the box lasts about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Themermaidone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is so easy to make and you can adjust the protein amount to your dog’s needs. I feed Honest Kitchen to my dog that has kidney disease and his values have greatly improved since eating Honest Kitchen Base mix. I add some supplements to help with his kidney issues. I have tried various other foods that claim to help with kidney disease; but, my dog won’t eat them.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like this a lot.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are vegan and get Natures Balance Vegetarian canned with a table spoon of nutritional yeast mixed in, then this as a gravy. They eat it up even though they are picky eaters and I know they are getting all the extra vitamins they need that aren't in any canned dog food. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Love Honest Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Love Honest Kitchen. The Kindly variety allows me to add whatever meat I want, and my Havanese loves it. I usually rotate lean ground beef, turkey, and chicken. I feed Zeal in the morning and Kindly with meat added in the evening. My dog's weight is great, and she has tons of energy, even at 10 years old. I am a fan of Honest Kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Cali Grl

customer_reviews.title: Unpractical and overwhelming smell
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately there's a lot of cons with this food, the smell is so overpowering, it made everything around it smell like it, not practical at all and really messy, my dogs face is completely green afterwards and I think the flavor is as overwhelming as the smell, because my dog could never eat more than half a cup and he is usually a big eater! I saw a lot of health benefits and that's what made me buy it but in practicality it doesn't work as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aline

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, high-quality, cost-effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a great part of a raw diet. We feed our dogs raw chicken, beef and fish. If I have the time, I cook a mixture of greens, berries, vegetables etc to supplement the protein..but I don't always have the time or ingredients to do this. This base mix does all the work for me and is very cost effective--and takes up a lot less space. You do have to plan ahead a bit to allow the mix to rehydrate (which means your dogs stare longingly at their bowls on the kitchen counter for 20 minutes while you wait for it to hydrate before adding their protein and then feeding them!), but it's worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Powdered poison
customer_reviews.text: My bull terrier developed seizures after eating this food for a few months. This stuff is poison and I’m confident it killed my dog. Go with a raw diet with REAL fruits and vegetables instead, not poison in powder format.
customer_reviews.author: Grover Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! Our dogs love this food. When they were eating dry food they would skip meals often. Since they have been on this food for the past few months none of them have missed a meal. We make it with ground turkey, chicken, baked chicken, chicken thighs, scrambled eggs... etc. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: its amazing human grade quality and my 18 year old dog ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this food for over ten years, its amazing human grade quality and my 18 year old dog loves it! Thank you HOnest Kitcehn
customer_reviews.author: jdcg

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: This product is so easy to use! My dog loves it and it has all the necessary vitamins and probiotics already incorporated. You mix it with warm water and wait three mins and it's ready to use. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to feed their pets a raw diet or homemade diet. No brainer!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Sofia

customer_reviews.title: food for after pancreatitis
customer_reviews.text: This is great for feeding my dog after pancreatitis. He needs fat free food. I just add raw chicken breast. He likes it and I feel good that it is all human grade made in the USA food. The company has been wonderful answering my question on email.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Moe

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING HEALING FOOD!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was constantly in the vet's office with stomach issues: vomiting in the morning (they recommended anti-acid tabs), loose stools (they recommended PancreaTabs), and even tried to operate on him thinking he had a misshapen stomach! Once I read "BEG" and began the same diet as the author of that book fed her dogs, NO MORE PROBLEMS with my dog's stomach. I LOVE this stuff ~ and it's human-grade food made my a very conscientious company (and Amazon give you free shipping :). Highly recommended for any dog but especially any dog that had loose stools consistently and eats grasses to vomit, etc. THIS WILL CURE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Branson & Barbara Branson

customer_reviews.title: I have searched long an hard and found the perfect commercial pup food.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dog food around that has an FDA approval. I would like to be able to prepare their food myself, but I haven't time. This frees me of my guilt for not doing it myself. It's actually as good as anyone could make at home, with the added assurance that they are getting all the vitamins and minerals they need. There are several types of 'The Honest Kitchen' foods you can buy. Some of them include the protein. I prefer adding the meats that I select They love it and even my picky Princess eats it with relish. Now THIS is unusual...
customer_reviews.author: ARK

customer_reviews.title: My Frenchton loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My French Bulldog/Boston Terrier mix was losing interest in his kibble, but when I mix a little bit of this up to go with the kibble he's in heaven! So far it doesn't give him gas or bad breath.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great Mix, Just Add Meat
customer_reviews.text: I used to make my own dog food, chopping and mixing veggies in with meat. I was never sure if I was giving my dog enough nutrients he needed and it was a pain to do all that prep work. I love the simplicity and variety of The Honest Kitchen base mix. It makes it so easy to add whatever meat I want (I usually do ground turkey) and just add water. When I first got my dog he was on a kibble diet but since I switched him over to a more natural, less processed diet his coat has become a lot shinier and healthier, and he certainly enjoys the food a lot more than the kibble!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Does not make dog stink
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Just observing the stools of my golden retriever Finnegan tells it all. He has no smelly issues (no stinky stool, no smelly coat, no smelly breath, nice shiny coat). Enough said. Most of all, he looks forward to his food and cleans his bowl clean.
customer_reviews.author: Aiko

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food and will jump up and down when it's mealtime!
customer_reviews.text: I have been alternating between the grain-free and the base mix that does have grain trying to figure out if my dog has a grain sensitivity. I haven't made up my mind yet but I can tell you my dog goes crazy when he sees me get the box and mix some of this with organic ground beef that I have sautéed. I have never had a dog jump up and down and dance all over the room before I started feeding him Honest Kitchen. I don't know which Base Mix I will end up using (grain-free or not) but this mix will be in my dog's diet for the rest of his life!
customer_reviews.author: GreenLady

customer_reviews.title: My dog hated it :(
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping my dog would like this but he hated it! The thing I liked least about it was if the food wasn't eaten right away it would crust over and harden. It was easy to use but not the right food for my dog. Too bad there isn't a guarantee, I would have liked to have received a partial refund at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: kaseynh

customer_reviews.title: My dog begs us to feed him!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food! He is super picky but I've never seen him so eager to eat. I was skeptical because of the way it smells but my dog can't get enough! It has an odor that reminds me of a freshly mowed lawn...but he doesn't care!
customer_reviews.author: M. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BASE FOOD
customer_reviews.text: in the wild dogs usually eat what's in the stomach of their prey which is fruits and veggies!! so this is very close to Nature. My dogs love this (as long as I add some meat). I think I have finally found the perfect food for my pack!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Azar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is great stuff, with good quality ingredients. An excellent way to start (or continue) on a raw food diet for your dogs. Easy to make up into a soft food for older dogs. My only complaint is that it is pretty expensive, as I'm feeding a cocker spaniel with a high metabolism, and a german shepherd, so I go through a box of this pretty quickly. I used to use 'Vet's All Natural' in Australia, which was the same sort of product, but was close to half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Niki K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for recipes for home cooked meals for my dog. After many hours of research and not having found what I feel is a balanced meal I came across this product. I like the fact that it is grain free, I like the ingredients and adding and rotating your own protein is great! Easy to prepare and my dog loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy, healthy, tasty
customer_reviews.text: Finally! An easy to prepare dog food that my picky eater loves and doesn't give him asthma and dandruff. I mix in a little drained, canned mackerel and his meals are the high point of his day! I use hot water and wait 10 minutes for the mix to completely rehydrate and expand.
customer_reviews.author: Giulia Gulia

customer_reviews.title: Does not smell appealing or appetizing
customer_reviews.text: This garbage smells like saw dust ,no way could it be good for your dog. Just buy the produce,blend it and freeze ... my dog will not eat this
customer_reviews.author: Young Hecty

customer_reviews.title: Best overall diet for my Multi Registry Champion Classic American Bully
customer_reviews.text: My Champion female American Bully looks thee best she ever has on this diet, as well as some of the best muscle definition, thick shiny coat, plenty of energy since she was a puppy! Also, one of my favorite producing kennels said this type of diet was their “secret formula,” so this was a must try. I use various proteins (tuna, sardines, ground beef & turkey, etc). After using various top quality kibble and seeing numerous recalls or food plant contamination’s I decided this would be the superior way to go!
customer_reviews.author: shaun gerecke

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy to find this product! Whenever I tell people that my dog is on raw food diet, they argue that my dog doesn’t take enough vitamins and minerals that kibbles have. I don’t wanna feed my dog processed food like kibbles. This product has all vitamins and minerals that dogs need! Plus human grade!!! I love the honest kitchen! Thank you for caring about dog’s health.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Lucy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My little picky eater loves this food! I started off with just a spoonful added to her fresh chicken and kibble. We are on day 5 now and no stomach issues! Instead of water, I have been using chicken stock (from her crockpot of chicken, frozen into ice cube trays and warmed up with her chicken). She is know about half Honest Kitchen and half kibble, plus her chicken. I am not a big fan of the scent, but it does bother her at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Necessary and Perfect for Raw Fed Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Honest Kitchen is a superb product for raw fed dogs. The base mix is outstanding. My dogs do not tolerate the "Kindly" mix very well. This mix has a lot of carrots. I switched back to the "Preference" base mix and the dogs (and their tummies) are happy again! You can't go wrong with Honest Kitchen - find your right mix, and your pet will do well. Oh - they do have samples available, so try the samples before buying a 7-pound box (like I made the mistake of doing).
customer_reviews.author: AdoreInVegas

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100+ pound pitbull that is on a raw food diet but lately I’ve been wanting to get more into his diet. I came across this brand randomly and decided to give it go. It’s been one week since I bought this for my dog and he loves it! I still add his raw meat into the mix but you can definitely see an improvement in his energy. I’ve already order a second box and I’m waiting to see how his coat will change. Overall 5 stars! No complaints here!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: My dogs hate it
customer_reviews.text: My dogs hate it no matter how I try to hide the taste. Bacon, beef, Turkey, nothing entices my dogs to eat it. It looks odd, a bright green.
customer_reviews.author: 22lanna

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn't like it at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back and I still have the pack almost untouched. My dog didn't like it much at all. Unfortunately I have to throw out the bag now.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent food, dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: The Honest Kitchen makes a wonderful line of convenient, easy to use high quality next, is close to a raw diet as you can get food for dogs! Only complaint is I wish the price was a little more affordable but an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Palmer-Panno

customer_reviews.title: Not for my scik dog
customer_reviews.text: I'm really sorry to give such a low rating but my dog is very sick and I thought she might be tempted to eat this after reading all the good reviews. I mixed it with fresh chicken and she still wouldn't touch it.
customer_reviews.author: Bookiebabe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding a home made diet for about a year. This base mix makes it much easier to feed her confidently that she is getting balanced nutrition, but I control the quality of protein ingredients. She is doing great on it and loves the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Huston

customer_reviews.title: Changed recipe?
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Honest Kitchen grain free base mix for almost 2 years. I have three staffies that eat ANYTHING. They scarf their food. And the last three boxes of this product they have all have not finished their food. We mix with ground beef and they eat the beef just fine. Wondering if the recipe quantities have changed?
customer_reviews.author: Halley

customer_reviews.title: Easy meal
customer_reviews.text: My Pomeranian loves this and I like knowing how much protein he’s getting each meal. I like being able to rotate a variety of proteins.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren1005

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVED it
customer_reviews.text: I started transitioning my dogs to this food tonight (grain free base mix) my vet recommended that I take at least a week to do the transition. I was hesitant because it looked like rabbit food and I couldn't see how my dogs would want to eat it. I mixed it with some meat and their kibble and they SCARFED it down and licked their bowls clean! I will definitely be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Alicyn M.

customer_reviews.title: This product used to be excellent. Now it is completely different
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be excellent. Now it is completely different, it is not an improved version but a cheaper version, it has a lots of cabbage and looks like powder. The first version with kale and carrots was really close to human grad. I am not sure if I will buy this food again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Yala

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: We sprinkle 1/4 cup between 3 dogs on top of their kibble. Then we add some water. It make a nice gravy and the dogs love it!
customer_reviews.author: E. LAMBERSON

customer_reviews.title: Green Face of happiness!!
customer_reviews.text: My Shih Tzu’s love this food with the tilapia I add. Only drawback is short fluffy faces end up with green beards. A wet washcloth takes care of that easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: AnnLeeWai

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Human Grade Dehydrated Grain Free Fruit & Veggie Base Mix for Dogs 7 lb - Preference
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Grain Free Fruit & Veggie Base Mix| Size:3 lb (makes 12 lbs)About grain free fruit & Veggie base mix recipe for dogsthe honest Kitchen grain free fruit and veggie base mix is a grain-free base mix where you choose your pup's favorite protein and simply add water. Since you select what meat is added, it's an excellent option for dogs that can't tolerate common protein sources or those who just like a little variety. It’s ingredients have also been verified as not Containing gmos by the non GMO project. as a grain-free dog food foundation diet, protein must be added with every Feeding. It's perfect for raw dog food feeders or those making a homemade dog food that are looking for an easier way to serve their own meat while ensuring their dog is getting all of its essential nutrients. no by-products or fillers> no additives or preservatives> No “4D” meats or feathers> no corn, wheat or soy no ingredients from China> No GMO ingredientsour suppliers must certify they meet the strictest standards for food safety and health as well as sustainability and fair-trade practices. Every year, Each of our suppliers signs Our “human food grade ” and “statement of quality and integrity. ” it’s not easy to become one of our supplies — and for good reason. benefits of dehydrated dog food pet food makers have figured out all kinds of ways to process their products. Most put your need for easy feeding way ahead of what's best for your pets. We don’t. That’s why we started with dehydrated foods. You’ll Tell by the true colors and fresh smells that they’re better for your pets. By gently dehydrating our ingredients, were able to retain more of the natural vitamins, minerals and nutrients that are often lost with traditional highly-processed pet food. Our ingredients are finely ground making them easier to digest. Because we remove all the water from our food, it’s super compact and nutrient dense. A 10lb box makes 40lbs of fresh food! why human gradefor veterinarians, food safety experts and savvy pet owners, there’s 100% human grade, and there’s everything else. It’s the best Pet food you can buy, ensuring a level of quality and safety no feed-grade product can claim. We use only the highest quality ingredients from sources we trust (and no phony, feed grade ingredients ever). our preparation methods and facilities meet safety standards 7x those of feed-grade ones. we do more than meet the highest Standard for food safety and quality — We invented It. A few other pet food brands have since followed our lead, but most continue to use inferior, feed-grade ingredients. Once you learn the difference, you’ll never go back to feed grade again. how to make it’s as easy as 1-2-3! 1. Just add water2. Wait 3 minutes while food rehydrates3. Serve with love! Nutrition Info: Calories : 337,% Protein :10.50,% Fat:8.00,% Fiber:8.00,% Moisture:10.00 (*Per dry cup)
feature_bullets: GRAIN FREE: This antioxident rich base mix recipe made with dehydrated ingredients allows for versatile, easy home cooking or raw feeding.
PICK YOUR OWN PROTEIN : Make the perfect balanced meal for adult & senior dogs of all breeds and sizes, based on their protein restrictions or preference.
HUMAN GRADE: The Honest Kitchen meets the rigorous FDA safety standards to use the label 'human grade', ensuring the highest quality dog food.
ALL NATURAL: This dog food is made with no by-products, preservatives or GMO ingredients - just add water and protein for a warm and delicious meal.
MADE IN THE USA: All ingredients are processed in the USA in a human grade food processing facility with nothing from China.
Preference is our grain-free base mix, which allows you to customize your pet's diet with the meat of your choice
It's perfect for raw dog food feeders
Preference is intended for supplemental feeding only
This diet contains a custom vitamin-mineral premix with balanced calcium, phosphorus ratios

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
